0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Gonioscopy; Diagnosis: 2.5% OPHTHALMIC solution used as needed to fill the gonioscopic prism
  • Operative procedure on anterior chamber of eye: instill a 2% OPHTHALMIC solution into the anterior chamber, as needed, using a 20-gauge or larger cannula
  • Surgical procedure on eye region, Involving perfusion of the eye: intraocular irrigating solution used according to operating surgeon's standard technique
  • Xerophthalmia: instill 1 drop 0.3% to 1% OPHTHALMIC solution into affected eye(s) 3 to 4 times daily, as needed

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Surgical procedure on eye region, Involving perfusion of the eye: intraocular irrigating solution used according to operating surgeon's standard technique
  • Xerophthalmia: (adolescents) instill 1 drop 0.3% to 1% OPHTHALMIC solution into affected eye(s) 3 to 4 times daily, as needed

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Gonioscopy; Diagnosis
  • Operative procedure on anterior chamber of eye
  • Surgical procedure on eye region, Involving perfusion of the eye
  • Xerophthalmia

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• avoid contamination of the applicator tip through contact
  • diabetic patients undergoing vitrectomy; risk of intraoperative lens changes (NAVSTEL(R))
  • remove viscoelastic solutions from the anterior chamber at the end of the surgical procedure
  • self-prescribed use as an ocular lubricant should not exceed 3 days
  • treat emergent elevations of intraocular pressure

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Neurologic:Headache (3%.)
  • Ophthalmic:Blurred vision (2%.), Cataract (11%.), Conjunctival hyperemia (4%.), Dry eye (3%.), Iritis (3%.), Macular retinal edema (4%.), Pain in eye (5%.), Posterior capsule opacification (2%.), Raised intraocular pressure (12%), Retinal hemorrhage (3%.)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Hypromellose is a nonpyrogenic viscoelastic solution that occupies space and protects tissue. When used in anterior segment surgeries, it allows for more efficient manipulation with less trauma to the ocular tissues, such as the corneal endothelium, by maintaining a deep chamber. The viscoelastic properties of hypromellose facilitates pushing back the vitreous face, which prevents the formation of a postoperative flat chamber.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intraocular
  • (Cellugel(R) OVD) inject sterile irrigating solution into the cannula hub and fill to the top
  • (Cellugel(R) OVD) purge all the air prior to use
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) use solution according to standard technique of operating surgeon
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) follow strict aseptic techniques during reconstitution
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) not for injection or intravenous infusion
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) do not use if solution is discolored or contains a precipitate
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) do not use unless product is clear, seal is intact, vacuum is present and container is undamaged
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) reconstitute just prior to surgery; use within 6 hours of mixing
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) do not use until Part I of solution is fully reconstituted with Part II
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) remove blue flip-off seals from both Part I bottle and Part II vial; prepare stoppers with sterile alcohol wipes
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) insert vacuum transfer device by inserting the white piercing pin into the Part II vial
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) invert Part II vial and immediately insert filter needle into the Part I bottle; fluid from Part II vial will automatically transfer into Part I bottle
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) an excess amount of solution is provided in each vial; a small amount of residual volume may remain in vial
  • (Navstel(R) Solution) place sterile safety cap over rubber stopper on Part I bottle if solution is not going to be used immediately; mix solution gently until uniform

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    Ophthalmic Solution: 0.4 %, 2.5 %
  • Cellugel Ovd
    Intraocular Solution: 2 %
  • GenTeal
    • Ophthalmic Gel/Jelly: 0.3 %
    • Ophthalmic Solution: 0.2 %, 0.3 %
  • Gonak
    Ophthalmic Solution: 2.5 %
  • Goniosoft
    Ophthalmic Solution: 2.5 %
  • Goniovisc
    Ophthalmic Solution: 2.5 %
  • Isopto Tears
    Ophthalmic Solution: 0.5 %
  • Nature's Tears
    Ophthalmic Solution: 0.4 %
  • Pure & Gentle
    Ophthalmic Solution: 0.3 %
  • Systane
    Ophthalmic Gel/Jelly: 0.3 %

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should report blurred vision or signs/symptoms of an eye infection or injury.
  • Instruct patient on proper instillation technique.
  • Advise patient to remove contact lenses prior to instilling drug. Lenses may be reinserted 15 min following instillation.
  • Patient should allow at least 5 min between instillation of this drug and other ophthalmic products.
